title: SHO energy - vertical block-spring compare v-max

content.question: Two identical blocks are each attached to the bottom end of different ideal springs, <math alttext="uppercase X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> and <math alttext="uppercase Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>. The top ends of these springs are fixed in place. Each block is held in place with each spring at its relaxed length, and the blocks are then released from rest and oscillate vertically. If the spring constant of Spring <math alttext="uppercase Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> is twice that of Spring <math alttext="uppercase X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, what is the maximum speed of the block hanging from Spring <math alttext="uppercase Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> in terms of the maximum speed <math alttext="v sub max comma uppercase X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mtext>max</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></msub></math> of the block hanging from Spring <math alttext="uppercase X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half v sub max comma uppercase X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mtext>max</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>
